sense.name: take a risk or guess in hope of a favorable outcome
sense.commentary: Note: Compare to Sense 2: in Sense 1, no game is being played.
sense.examples: Bennett gambled throughout the president's impeachment. The CEO gambled with the stockholders' money, but the acquisition was a bust. The man gambled at life. I'm going to gamble here, but I think we're lost. Polly might show up, but I wouldn't gamble on it.

sense.name: wager on a game, race, or competition for money or valuables
sense.commentary: Note: Compare to Sense 1: Sense 2 refers to organized events of wagering, in which all participants voluntarily risk money or valuables on the outcome of something.
sense.examples: Since I gambled all my money away, I don't have any for rent. My boyfriend loves to gamble at blackjack. Let's go to Vegas and gamble!
